CStatusBarControl

The status bar.  Can only be used once per window.

This control extends CControl.  All basic properties and functions are implemented and documented in this class.

Summary
CStatusBarControlThe status bar.
Properties
PartsAn array of status bar parts/segments.
TextThe text of the first part.
CStatusBarControl.CPartsAn array of StatusBar parts/segments.
Properties
1,2,3,4,...Individual parts can be accessed by their index.
Functions
MaxIndexReturns the number of parts.
AddAdds a part.
RemoveRemoves a part.
CStatusBarControl.CParts.CPartA single part object.
Properties
TextThe text of this part.
PartNumberThe index of this part.
WidthThe width of this part.
StyleThe style of this part.
IconThe path to the icon file assigned to this part.
IconNumberThe index of the icon in a multi-icon file.
Events
Introduction1) Use an event handler.
Click(PartIndex)Invoked when the user clicked on the control.
DoubleClick(PartIndex)Invoked when the user double-clicked on the control.
RightClick(PartIndex)Invoked when the user right-clicked on the control.
DoubleRightClick(PartIndex)Invoked when the user double-right-clicked on the control.

Properties

Parts

An array of status bar parts/segments.  See CStatusBarControl.CParts

Text

The text of the first part.

CStatusBarControl.CParts

An array of StatusBar parts/segments.

Summary
Properties
1,2,3,4,...Individual parts can be accessed by their index.
Functions
MaxIndexReturns the number of parts.
AddAdds a part.
RemoveRemoves a part.

Properties

1,2,3,4,...

Individual parts can be accessed by their index.  Returns an object of type CStatusBarControl.CParts.CPart

Functions

MaxIndex

Returns the number of parts.

Add

Adds a part.

Parameters

TextThe text of the part.
PartNumberThe position at which the new part will appear.
WidthThe width of the new part.
StyleStyle options for the new part.  See AHK documentation.
IconAn icon filename for the part.
IconNumberThe index of the icon in a multi-icon file.

Remove

Removes a part.

Parameters

PartNumberThe index of the part which should be removed.

CStatusBarControl.CParts.CPart

A single part object.

Summary
Properties
TextThe text of this part.
PartNumberThe index of this part.
WidthThe width of this part.
StyleThe style of this part.
IconThe path to the icon file assigned to this part.
IconNumberThe index of the icon in a multi-icon file.
Events
Introduction1) Use an event handler.
Click(PartIndex)Invoked when the user clicked on the control.
DoubleClick(PartIndex)Invoked when the user double-clicked on the control.
RightClick(PartIndex)Invoked when the user right-clicked on the control.
DoubleRightClick(PartIndex)Invoked when the user double-right-clicked on the control.

Properties

Text

The text of this part.

PartNumber

The index of this part.

Width

The width of this part.

Style

The style of this part.  See AHK docs.

Icon

The path to the icon file assigned to this part.

IconNumber

The index of the icon in a multi-icon file.

Events

Introduction

There are currently 3 methods to handle control events

1) Use an event handler.  Simply use control.EventName.Handler := “HandlingFunction” Instead of “HandlingFunction” it is also possible to pass a function reference or a Delegate: control.EventName.Handler := new Delegate(Object, “HandlingFunction”) If this method is used, the first parameter will contain the control object that sent this event.

2) Create a function with this naming scheme in your window class: ControlName_EventName(params)

3) Instead of using ControlName_EventName() you may also call CControl.RegisterEvent on a control instance to register a different event function name.  This method is deprecated since event handlers are more flexible.

The parameters depend on the event and there may not be params at all in some cases.

Click(PartIndex)

Invoked when the user clicked on the control.

DoubleClick(PartIndex)

Invoked when the user double-clicked on the control.

RightClick(PartIndex)

Invoked when the user right-clicked on the control.

DoubleRightClick(PartIndex)

Invoked when the user double-right-clicked on the control.

Basic control class from which all controls extend.
An array of StatusBar parts/segments.
A single part object.
Attention!
